member.name: T:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Benchmark
member.summary: Provides methods to control benchmark execution.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Benchmark.Iterations
member.summary: Gets a sequence of benchmark iterations.
member.remarks: Call on each iteration before executing the code to be measured.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Benchmark.Iterate(System.Action)
member.summary: Automatically iterate over a measured operation.
member.param: The operation to measure and iterate over.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Benchmark.IterateAsync(System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Automatically iterate over an asynchronous measured operation.
member.param: The operation to measure and iterate over.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.BenchmarkAttribute
member.summary: Attribute that is applied to a method to indicate that it is a performance test that should be run and measured by the performance test runner.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.BenchmarkIteration
member.summary: Represents a single iteration of a benchmark.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.BenchmarkIteration.StartMeasurement
member.summary: Starts measuring performance metrics for this iteration.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.BenchmarkIterationMeasurement
member.summary: Represents an ongoing measurement of a benchmark iteration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.BenchmarkIterationMeasurement.Dispose
member.summary: Completes measurement of this iteration.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Internal.BenchmarkIterator
member.summary: Provides iterations for

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Internal.BenchmarkIterator.RunAsync(System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Runs the specified method with this as the iterator.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Internal.BenchmarkIterator.Iterations
member.summary: Gets the iterations for the current benchmark

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Internal.BenchmarkIterator.StartMeasurement(System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts measurement for the given iteration, if it is the current iteration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Internal.BenchmarkIterator.StopMeasurement(System.Int32)
member.summary: Stops measurement for the given iteration, if it is the current iteration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Internal.BenchmarkIterator.CreateIteration(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance for the given iteration.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Sdk.IPerformanceMetricAttribute
member.summary: Marker interface used by attributes which provide performance metric data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Sdk.IPerformanceMetricDiscoverer
member.summary: Implemented by discoverers that provide metrics to performance tests.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Sdk.IPerformanceMetricDiscoverer.GetMetrics(Xunit.Abstractions.IAttributeInfo)
member.summary: Gets the performance metrics from the metric attribute.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Sdk.PerformanceMetricDiscovererAttribute
member.summary: An attribute used to decorate classes which implement , to indicate how performance metrics should be discovered. The discoverer type must implement .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Sdk.PerformanceMetricDiscovererAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .
member.param: The fully qualified name of the discoverer.
The name of the assembly that the discoverer type is located in, without file extension.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Sdk.PerformanceMetricInfo
member.summary: Provides information about a performance metric

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Sdk.PerformanceMetricInfo.Id
member.summary: Gets a string that uniquely identifies this metric, and can be used as an element or attribute name in XML output.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Sdk.PerformanceMetricInfo.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets the human-readable name of the metric.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Sdk.PerformanceMetricInfo.Unit
member.summary: Gets a string describing the units of measurement for this metric. Use one of the pre-defined strings in .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Sdk.PerformanceMetricInfo.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new PerformamceMetricInfo

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Sdk.PerformanceMetricUnits
member.summary: Provides standard strings for

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Sdk.PerformanceMetricUnits.Count
member.summary: Indicates that a performance metric's value is a unitless count.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Sdk.PerformanceMetricUnits.Milliseconds
member.summary: Indicates that a performance metric's value is measures in milliseconds.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.Sdk.PerformanceMetricUnits.Bytes
member.summary: Indicates that a performance metric's value is measured in bytes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.MeasureGCAllocationsAttribute
member.summary: An attribute that is applied to a method, class, or assembly, to indicate that the performance test framework should collect and report the total size of objects allocated on the GC heap.
member.remarks: Note that the underlying GC events used to collect this data report samples of aggregates of object allocations. Even if every iteration of the test allocates, many iterations may report zero allocations. The average value collected across all iterations should give a meaningful measure of per-iteration allocations.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.MeasureInstructionsRetiredAttribute
member.summary: An attribute that is applied to a method, class, or assembly, to indicate that the performance test framework should collect and report the number of instructions retired per test iteration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.MeasureInstructionsRetiredAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Mesaure instructions retired using the default sampling interval

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.MeasureInstructionsRetiredAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Measure instructions retired using the specified sampling interval
member.param: The maximum number of retired instructions to include in each sample. If this it outside of the valid range for the machine being tested, the nearest valid value will be used instead. A suggested starting point for this value is 100,000.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.MeasureGCCountsAttribute
member.summary: An attribute that is applied to a method, class, or assembly, to indicate that the performance test framework should collect and report GC counts for the given test(s).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xunit.Performance.OptimizeForBenchmarksAttribute
member.summary: Apply this attribute to an assembly if it contains benchmarks. This attribute configures xUnit for benchmark execution.
